# Apple Inc. – ESG Trend Report (FY 2019‑2025)

**Executive Summary**
Apple has made measurable progress across all core ESG metrics over the past five years. Carbon intensity fell from 120 to 105 tCO₂e per $M revenue, water usage dropped from 500 to 430 m³ per $M revenue, board diversity rose from 30 % to 36 %, and waste recycled increased from 60 % to 68 %.

**Metric Trends**
| Year | Carbon Intensity (tCO₂e/$M) | Water Usage (m³/$M) | Board Diversity (%) | Waste Recycled (%) |
|------|----------------------------|--------------------|----------------------|--------------------|
| 2019 | 120 | 500 | 30 | 60 |
| 2020 | 115 | 480 | 32 | 62 |
| 2021 | 110 | 460 | 34 | 64 |
| 2022 | 108 | 440 | 35 | 66 |
| 2023 | 105 | 430 | 36 | 68 |
| **2024 (Est.)** | 103 | 425 | 38 | 70 |
| **2025 (Est.)** | 101 | 420 | 40 | 72 |

**Trend Analysis**
Apple shows a steady reduction in carbon intensity (average -3.5 tCO₂e per year) and water usage, while board diversity and waste recycling are improving incrementally. The forward‑looking estimates assume continuation of the historical linear trends.

*Prepared by EcoReportAI*
